skill.name: vm-template-creation
skill.description: Create, configure, and manage VM templates in Proxmox. Build reusable VM images for rapid deployment of standardized environments, including Kubernetes clusters and managed applications.
skill.summary: Create and manage VM templates in Proxmox for rapid, standardized infrastructure deployment.
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown content. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities are present. The skill describes Proxmox MCP tool usage but contains no actual code.

content.user_title: Create Proxmox VM templates for rapid deployment
content.value_statement: Building VM templates manually takes significant time and leads to inconsistent configurations. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for creating reusable Proxmox VM templates, enabling standardized infrastructure deployment in minutes instead of hours.
actual_capabilities: Create VM templates from cloud images or custom configurations
Convert configured VMs into reusable templates
Clone templates to deploy multiple standardized VMs
Configure Cloud-Init settings for automated provisioning
Build specialized templates for Kubernetes and applications
limitations: Templates cannot be booted directly (must be cloned first)
Large templates require more time to clone across the cluster
Network configuration occurs post-clone via Cloud-Init
Disk image import requires manual Proxmox CLI steps

use_cases.title: Standardize Kubernetes Infrastructure
use_cases.description: Build RKE2-ready Ubuntu templates for consistent Kubernetes cluster deployment across development and production environments.

use_cases.title: Rapid VM Provisioning
use_cases.description: Create application-specific templates to deploy identical servers in minutes for web, database, and CI/CD workloads.

use_cases.title: Maintain IaC Consistency
use_cases.description: Develop versioned templates with documented configurations to ensure infrastructure consistency across the organization.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Template Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a template VM named ubuntu-22.04-template on node pve2 with 2 CPU cores, 4GB memory, and 50GB disk for Cloud-Init deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Mark VM as Template
prompt_templates.prompt: Mark VM 100 on pve2 as a template so it can be cloned for deployments.

prompt_templates.title: Kubernetes Cluster Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Clone ubuntu-rke2-template (VM 100) three times to create control plane nodes named rancher-1, rancher-2, and rancher-3 with full clone mode.

prompt_templates.title: Template Update Workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: Update existing template with new configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Clone template VM 100 to VM 900 as a test instance, then guide me through updating it with Docker support and security patches before creating a new versioned template.

output_examples.input: Create a template VM for Ubuntu 22.04 with RKE2 Kubernetes support
output: Step 1: Create base VM with cloud image

best_practices: Use Cloud-Init for network and hostname configuration to keep templates minimal and portable
Apply security hardening and patches before marking a VM as a template
Document template versions, contents, and creation dates for audit and reproducibility
anti_patterns: Booting templates directly instead of cloning them first
Leaving sensitive data or credentials on VMs before converting to templates
Using thick provisioning for templates when thin provisioning provides better storage efficiency

faq.question: What Proxmox versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill works with Proxmox VE 7.x and 8.x. MCP tools require API access to your Proxmox node.

faq.question: How many VMs can I clone from a template?
faq.answer: There is no limit on clone count. Each clone is an independent VM with its own resources.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with Terraform?
faq.answer: Yes. Use MCP tools interactively for template preparation, then Terraform for production-scale cloning.

faq.question: Is my data safe when creating templates?
faq.answer: This skill only generates configuration guidance. Actual VM operations are performed by Proxmox MCP tools on your infrastructure.

faq.question: Why do my cloned VMs have the same IP address?
faq.answer: Templates store initial network config. Use Cloud-Init with DHCP or unique static IPs per clone for proper networking.

faq.question: How is this different from Terraform Proxmox provider?
faq.answer: Terraform manages infrastructure state at scale. This skill provides interactive guidance for template design and testing.
